scene.scenelocation: Vienna. An apartment in the Duke’s palace.

stagedir.dir: Enter Duke, Escalus, Lords, and Attendants.

scene.line: What figure of us think you he will bear?
For you must know, we have with special soul
Elected him our absence to supply,
Lent him our terror, dress’d him with our love,
And given his deputation all the organs
Of our own pow’r. What think you of it?

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: If any in Vienna be of worth
To undergo such ample grace and honor,
It is Lord Angelo.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Look where he comes.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Always obedient to your Grace’s will,
I come to know your pleasure.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Angelo:
There is a kind of character in thy life,
That to th’ observer doth thy history
Fully unfold. Thyself and thy belongings
Are not thine own so proper as to waste
Thyself upon thy virtues, they on thee.
Heaven doth with us as we with torches do,
Not light them for themselves; for if our virtues
Did not go forth of us, ’twere all alike
As if we had them not. Spirits are not finely touch’d
But to fine issues; nor Nature never lends
The smallest scruple of her excellence,
But like a thrifty goddess, she determines
Herself the glory of a creditor,
Both thanks and use. But I do bend my speech
To one that can my part in him advertise.
Hold therefore, Angelo:
In our remove be thou at full ourself.
Mortality and mercy in Vienna
Live in thy tongue and heart. Old Escalus,
Though first in question, is thy secondary.
Take thy commission.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Now, good my lord,
Let there be some more test made of my mettle
Before so noble and so great a figure
Be stamp’d upon it.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: No more evasion.
We have with a leaven’d and prepared choice
Proceeded to you; therefore take your honors.
Our haste from hence is of so quick condition
That it prefers itself, and leaves unquestion’d
Matters of needful value. We shall write to you,
As time and our concernings shall importune,
How it goes with us, and do look to know
What doth befall you here. So fare you well.
To th’ hopeful execution do I leave you
Of your commissions.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Yet give leave, my lord,
That we may bring you something on the way.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: My haste may not admit it,
Nor need you (on mine honor) have to do
With any scruple. Your scope is as mine own,
So to enforce or qualify the laws
As to your soul seems good. Give me your hand,
I’ll privily away. I love the people,
But do not like to stage me to their eyes;
Though it do well, I do not relish well
Their loud applause and aves vehement;
Nor do I think the man of safe discretion
That does affect it. Once more fare you well.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: The heavens give safety to your purposes!

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Lead forth and bring you back in happiness!

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: I thank you. Fare you well.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: If the Duke with the other dukes come not to composition with the King of Hungary, why then all the dukes fall upon the King.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Heaven grant us its peace, but not the King of Hungary’s!

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: Amen.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Thou conclud’st like the sanctimonious pirate, that went to sea with the Ten Commandements, but scrap’d one out of the table.

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: “Thou shalt not steal”?

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Ay, that he raz’d.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Why, ’twas a commandement to command the captain and all the rest from their functions; they put forth to steal. There’s not a soldier of us all, that in the thanksgiving before meat, do relish the petition well that prays for peace.

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: I never heard any soldier dislike it.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: I believe thee; for I think thou never wast where grace was said.

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: No? A dozen times at least.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: What? In metre?

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: In any proportion, or in any language.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: I think, or in any religion.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Ay, why not? Grace is grace, despite of all controversy; as for example, thou thyself art a wicked villain, despite of all grace.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Well; there went but a pair of shears between us.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: I grant; as there may between the lists and the velvet. Thou art the list.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: And thou the velvet—thou art good velvet; thou’rt a three-pil’d piece, I warrant thee. I had as lief be a list of an English kersey as be pil’d, as thou art pil’d, for a French velvet. Do I speak feelingly now?

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: I think thou dost; and indeed with most painful feeling of thy speech. I will, out of thine own confession, learn to begin thy health; but, whilst I live, forget to drink after thee.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: I think I have done myself wrong, have I not?

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: Yes, that thou hast; whether thou art tainted or free.

speech.speaker: MRS. OV.
speech.line: Thus, what with the war, what with the sweat, what with the gallows, and what with poverty, I am custom-shrunk.

speech.speaker: CLAUD.
speech.line: Fellow, why dost thou show me thus to th’ world?
Bear me to prison, where I am committed.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: I do it not in evil disposition,
But from Lord Angelo by special charge.

speech.speaker: CLAUD.
speech.line: Thus can the demigod, Authority,
Make us pay down for our offense by weight
The words of heaven: on whom it will, it will;
On whom it will not, so; yet still ’tis just.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: No; holy father, throw away that thought;
Believe not that the dribbling dart of love
Can pierce a complete bosom. Why I desire thee
To give me secret harbor, hath a purpose
More grave and wrinkled than the aims and ends
Of burning youth.

speech.speaker: FRI. PET.
speech.line: May your Grace speak of it?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: My holy sir, none better knows than you
How I have ever lov’d the life removed,
And held in idle price to haunt assemblies
Where youth, and cost, witless bravery keeps.
I have deliver’d to Lord Angelo
(A man of stricture and firm abstinence)
My absolute power and place here in Vienna,
And he supposes me travell’d to Poland
(For so I have strew’d it in the common ear,
And so it is receiv’d). Now, pious sir,
You will demand of me why I do this.

speech.speaker: FRI. PET.
speech.line: Gladly, my lord.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: We have strict statutes and most biting laws
(The needful bits and curbs to headstrong weeds),
Which for this fourteen years we have let slip,
Even like an o’ergrown lion in a cave,
That goes not out to prey. Now, as fond fathers,
Having bound up the threat’ning twigs of birch,
Only to stick it in their children’s sight
For terror, not to use, in time the rod
Becomes more mock’d than fear’d; so our decrees,
Dead to infliction, to themselves are dead,
And liberty plucks justice by the nose;
The baby beats the nurse, and quite athwart
Goes all decorum.

speech.speaker: FRI. PET.
speech.line: It rested in your Grace
To unloose this tied-up justice when you pleas’d:
And it in you more dreadful would have seem’d
Than in Lord Angelo.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: I do fear—too dreadful;
Sith ’twas my fault to give the people scope,
’Twould be my tyranny to strike and gall them
For what I bid them do; for we bid this be done,
When evil deeds have their permissive pass,
And not the punishment. Therefore indeed, my father,
I have on Angelo impos’d the office,
Who may, in th’ ambush of my name, strike home,
And yet my nature never in the fight
To do in slander. And to behold his sway,
I will, as ’twere a brother of your order,
Visit both prince and people; therefore I prithee
Supply me with the habit, and instruct me
How I may formally in person bear
Like a true friar. More reasons for this action
At our more leisure shall I render you;
Only, this one: Lord Angelo is precise;
Stands at a guard with envy; scarce confesses
That his blood flows; or that his appetite
Is more to bread than stone: hence shall we see
If power change purpose: what our seemers be.

stagedir.dir: Enter Isabel and Francisca, a nun.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Peace and prosperity! Who is’t that calls?

stagedir.dir: Enter Angelo, Escalus, and Servants, Justice.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Be it as your wisdom will.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Where is the Provost?

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: Here, if it like your honor.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: See that Claudio
Be executed by nine tomorrow morning.
Bring him his confessor, let him be prepar’d,
For that’s the utmost of his pilgrimage.

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: Come, bring them away. If these be good people in a commonweal that do nothing but use their abuses in common houses, I know no law. Bring them away.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: How now, sir, what’s your name? And what’s the matter?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: If it please your honor, I am the poor Duke’s constable, and my name is Elbow. I do lean upon justice, sir, and do bring in here before your good honor two notorious benefactors.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Benefactors? Well; what benefactors are they? Are they not malefactors?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: If it please your honor, I know not well what they are; but precise villains they are, that I am sure of, and void of all profanation in the world that good Christians ought to have.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: This comes off well. Here’s a wise officer.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Go to; what quality are they of? Elbow is your name?
Why dost thou not speak, Elbow?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: He cannot, sir; he’s out at elbow.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: What are you, sir?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: He, sir! A tapster, sir; parcel-bawd; one that serves a bad woman; whose house, sir, was (as they say) pluck’d down in the suburbs; and now she professes a hot-house; which, I think, is a very ill house too.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: How know you that?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: My wife, sir, whom I detest before heaven and your honor—

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: How? Thy wife?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: Ay, sir; whom I thank heaven is an honest woman.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Dost thou detest her therefore?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: I say, sir, I will detest myself also, as well as she, that this house, if it be not a bawd’s house, it is pity of her life, for it is a naughty house.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: How dost thou know that, constable?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: Marry, sir, by my wife, who, if she had been a woman cardinally given, might have been accus’d in fornication, adultery, and all uncleanliness there.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: By the woman’s means?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: Ay, sir, by Mistress Overdone’s means; but as she spit in his face, so she defied him.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Sir, if it please your honor, this is not so.

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: Prove it before these varlets here, thou honorable man, prove it.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Do you hear how he misplaces?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Sir, she came in great with child; and longing (saving your honors’ reverence) for stew’d prunes. Sir, we had but two in the house, which at that very distant time stood, as it were, in a fruit-dish, a dish of some threepence—your honors have seen such dishes; they are not china dishes, but very good dishes.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Go to, go to; no matter for the dish, sir.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: No indeed, sir, not of a pin; you are therein in the right. But to the point. As I say, this Mistress Elbow, being (as I say) with child, and being great-bellied, and longing (as I said) for prunes; and having but two in the dish (as I said), Master Froth here, this very man, having eaten the rest (as I said) and (as I say) paying for them very honestly; for, as you know, Master Froth, I could not give you threepence again.

speech.speaker: FROTH.
speech.line: No indeed.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Very well; you being then (if you be rememb’red) cracking the stones of the foresaid prunes—

speech.speaker: FROTH.
speech.line: Ay, so I did indeed.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Why, very well; I telling you then (if you be rememb’red) that such a one and such a one were past cure of the thing you wot of, unless they kept very good diet, as I told you—

speech.speaker: FROTH.
speech.line: All this is true.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Why, very well then—

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Come; you are a tedious fool. To the purpose: what was done to Elbow’s wife, that he hath cause to complain of? Come me to what was done to her.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Sir, your honor cannot come to that yet.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: No, sir, nor I mean it not.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Sir, but you shall come to it, by your honor’s leave. And I beseech you, look into Master Froth here, sir; a man of fourscore pound a year; whose father died at Hallowmas. Was’t not at Hallowmas, Master Froth?

speech.speaker: FROTH.
speech.line: All-hallond eve.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Why, very well; I hope here be truths. He, sir, sitting (as I say) in a lower chair, sir—’twas in the Bunch of Grapes, where indeed you have a delight to sit, have you not?

speech.speaker: FROTH.
speech.line: I have so, because it is an open room and good for winter.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Why, very well then; I hope here be truths.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: This will last out a night in Russia
When nights are longest there. I’ll take my leave,
And leave you to the hearing of the cause,
Hoping you’ll find good cause to whip them all.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: I think no less. Good morrow to your lordship.
What trade are you of, sir?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: A tapster, a poor widow’s tapster.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Your mistress’ name?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Mistress Overdone.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Hath she had any more than one husband?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Nine, sir; Overdone by the last.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Nine? Come hither to me, Master Froth. Master Froth, I would not have you acquainted with tapsters; they will draw you. Master Froth, and you will hang them. Get you gone, and let me hear no more of you.

speech.speaker: FROTH.
speech.line: I thank your worship. For mine own part, I never come into any room in a tap-house, but I am drawn in.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Well; no more of it, Master Froth. Farewell.
but I shall follow it as the flesh and fortune shall better determine.
Whip me? No, no, let carman whip his jade,
The valiant heart’s not whipt out of his trade.

scene.line: What’s a’ clock, think you?

speech.speaker: JUST.
speech.line: Eleven, sir.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: I pray you home to dinner with me.

speech.speaker: JUST.
speech.line: I humbly thank you.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: It grieves me for the death of Claudio,
But there’s no remedy.

speech.speaker: JUST.
speech.line: Lord Angelo is severe.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: It is but needful.
Mercy is not itself, that oft looks so;
Pardon is still the nurse of second woe.
But yet, poor Claudio; there is no remedy.
Come, sir.

scene.line: I’ll know
His pleasure, may be he will relent. Alas,
He hath but as offended in a dream!
All sects, all ages smack of this vice, and he
To die for’t!

speech.speaker: SERV.
speech.line: Here is the sister of the man condemn’d
Desires access to you.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Hath he a sister?

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: Ay, my good lord, a very virtuous maid,
And to be shortly of a sisterhood,
If not already.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Well; let her be admitted.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: ’Save your honor!

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Stay a little while.
Heaven give thee moving graces!

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Condemn the fault, and not the actor of it?
Why, every fault’s condemn’d ere it be done.
Mine were the very cipher of a function,
To fine the faults whose fine stands in record,
And let go by the actor.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: O just but severe law!
I had a brother then. Heaven keep your honor!

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Give’t not o’er so. To him again, entreat him,
Kneel down before him, hang upon his gown;
You are too cold. If you should need a pin,
You could not with more tame a tongue desire it;
To him, I say!

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Must he needs die?

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Maiden, no remedy.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Yes; I do think that you might pardon him,
And neither heaven nor man grieve at the mercy.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: I will not do’t.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: But can you if you would?

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Look what I will not, that I cannot do.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: But might you do’t, and do the world no wrong,
If so your heart were touch’d with that remorse
As mine is to him?

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: He’s sentenc’d; ’tis too late.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: You are too cold.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Too late? Why, no; I that do speak a word
May call it again. Well, believe this,
No ceremony that to great ones ’longs,
Not the king’s crown, nor the deputed sword,
The marshal’s truncheon, nor the judge’s robe,
Become them with one half so good a grace
As mercy does.
If he had been as you, and you as he,
You would have slipp’d like him, but he, like you,
Would not have been so stern.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Pray you be gone.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: I would to heaven I had your potency,
And you were Isabel! Should it then be thus?
No; I would tell what ’twere to be a judge,
And what a prisoner.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Ay, touch him; there’s the vein.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Your brother is a forfeit of the law,
And you but waste your words.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Alas, alas!
Why, all the souls that were were forfeit once,
And He that might the vantage best have took
Found out the remedy. How would you be
If He, which is the top of judgment, should
But judge you as you are? O, think on that,
And mercy then will breathe within your lips,
Like man new made.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Be you content, fair maid,
It is the law, not I, condemn your brother.
Were he my kinsman, brother, or my son,
It should be thus with him: he must die tomorrow.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Tomorrow? O, that’s sudden! Spare him, spare him!
He’s not prepar’d for death. Even for our kitchens
We kill the fowl of season. Shall we serve heaven
With less respect than we do minister
To our gross selves? Good, good my lord, bethink you:
Who is it that hath died for this offense?
There’s many have committed it.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Ay, well said.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: The law hath not been dead, though it hath slept.
Those many had not dar’d to do that evil
If the first that did th’ edict infringe
Had answer’d for his deed. Now ’tis awake,
Takes note of what is done, and like a prophet
Looks in a glass that shows what future evils,
Either now, or by remissness new conceiv’d,
And so in progress to be hatch’d and born,
Are now to have no successive degrees,
But here they live, to end.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Yet show some pity.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: I show it most of all when I show justice;
For then I pity those I do not know,
Which a dismiss’d offense would after gall,
And do him right that, answering one foul wrong,
Lives not to act another. Be satisfied;
Your brother dies tomorrow; be content.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: So you must be the first that gives this sentence,
And he, that suffers. O, it is excellent
To have a giant’s strength; but it is tyrannous
To use it like a giant.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: That’s well said.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Could great men thunder
As Jove himself does, Jove would never be quiet,
For every pelting, petty officer
Would use his heaven for thunder,
Nothing but thunder! Merciful heaven,
Thou rather with thy sharp and sulphurous bolt
Splits the unwedgeable and gnarled oak
Than the soft myrtle; but man, proud man,
Dress’d in a little brief authority,
Most ignorant of what he’s most assur’d
(His glassy essence), like an angry ape
Plays such fantastic tricks before high heaven
As makes the angels weep; who, with our spleens,
Would all themselves laugh mortal.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: O, to him, to him, wench! He will relent.
He’s coming; I perceive’t.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: Pray heaven she win him!

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: We cannot weigh our brother with ourself.
Great men may jest with saints; ’tis wit in them,
But in the less foul profanation.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Thou’rt i’ th’ right, girl, more o’ that.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: That in the captain’s but a choleric word,
Which in the soldier is flat blasphemy.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Art avis’d o’ that? More on’t.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Why do you put these sayings upon me?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Because authority, though it err like others,
Hath yet a kind of medicine in itself,
That skins the vice o’ th’ top. Go to your bosom,
Knock there, and ask your heart what it doth know
That’s like my brother’s fault. If it confess
A natural guiltiness such as is his,
Let it not sound a thought upon your tongue
Against my brother’s life.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: She speaks, and ’tis
Such sense that my sense breeds with it.—Fare you well.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Gentle my lord, turn back.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: I will bethink me. Come again tomorrow.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Hark how I’ll bribe you. Good my lord, turn back.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: How? Bribe me?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Ay, with such gifts that heaven shall share with you.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: You had marr’d all else.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Not with fond sicles of the tested gold,
Or stones, whose rate are either rich or poor
As fancy values them; but with true prayers,
That shall be up at heaven, and enter there
Ere sun-rise, prayers from preserved souls,
From fasting maids, whose minds are dedicate
To nothing temporal.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Well; come to me tomorrow.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Go to; ’tis well. Away!

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Heaven keep your honor safe!

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Amen!
For I am that way going to temptation,
Where prayers cross.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: At what hour tomorrow
Shall I attend your lordship?

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: At any time ’fore noon.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: ’Save your honor!

stagedir.dir: Enter Duke disguised as a friar and Provost, meeting.

scene.line: Look, here comes one; a gentlewoman of mine,
Who, falling in the flaws of her own youth,
Hath blister’d her report. She is with child,
And he that got it, sentenc’d; a young man
More fit to do another such offense
Than die for this.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: When must he die?

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: As I do think, tomorrow.

speech.speaker: JUL.
speech.line: Must die tomorrow? O injurious love,
That respites me a life whose very comfort
Is still a dying horror!

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: ’Tis pity of him.

scene.line: How now? Who’s there?

speech.speaker: SERV.
speech.line: One Isabel, a sister, desires access to you.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Teach her the way.
How now, fair maid?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: I am come to know your pleasure.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: That you might know it, would much better please me
Than to demand what ’tis. Your brother cannot live.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Even so. Heaven keep your honor!

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Yet may he live a while; and it may be
As long as you or I. Yet he must die.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Under your sentence?

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Yea.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: When, I beseech you? That in his reprieve,
Longer or shorter, he may be so fitted
That his soul sicken not.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Ha? Fie, these filthy vices! It were as good
To pardon him that hath from nature stol’n
A man already made, as to remit
Their saucy sweetness that do coin heaven’s image
In stamps that are forbid. ’Tis all as easy
Falsely to take away a life true made
As to put metal in restrained means
To make a false one.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: ’Tis set down so in heaven, but not in earth.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Say you so? Then I shall pose you quickly.
Which had you rather, that the most just law
Now took your brother’s life, or, to redeem him,
Give up your body to such sweet uncleanness
As she that he hath stain’d?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Sir, believe this,
I had rather give my body than my soul.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: I talk not of your soul; our compell’d sins
Stand more for number than for accompt.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: How say you?

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Nay, I’ll not warrant that; for I can speak
Against the thing I say. Answer to this:
I (now the voice of the recorded law)
Pronounce a sentence on your brother’s life;
Might there not be a charity in sin
To save this brother’s life?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Please you to do’t,
I’ll take it as a peril to my soul,
It is no sin at all, but charity.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Pleas’d you to do’t at peril of your soul,
Were equal poise of sin and charity.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: That I do beg his life, if it be sin,
Heaven let me bear it! You granting of my suit,
If that be sin, I’ll make it my morn-prayer
To have it added to the faults of mine,
And nothing of your answer.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Nay, but hear me,
Your sense pursues not mine. Either you are ignorant,
Or seem so craftily; and that’s not good.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Let me be ignorant, and in nothing good,
But graciously to know I am no better.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Thus wisdom wishes to appear most bright
When it doth tax itself; as these black masks
Proclaim an enshield beauty ten times louder
Than beauty could, displayed. But mark me:
To be received plain, I’ll speak more gross:
Your brother is to die.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: So.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: And his offense is so, as it appears,
Accountant to the law upon that pain.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: True.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Admit no other way to save his life
(As I subscribe not that, nor any other,
But in the loss of question), that you, his sister,
Finding yourself desir’d of such a person,
Whose credit with the judge, or own great place,
Could fetch your brother from the manacles
Of the all-binding law; and that there were
No earthly mean to save him, but that either
You must lay down the treasures of your body
To this supposed, or else to let him suffer—
What would you do?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: As much for my poor brother as myself:
That is, were I under the terms of death,
Th’ impression of keen whips I’ld wear as rubies,
And strip myself to death, as to a bed
That longing have been sick for, ere I’ld yield
My body up to shame.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Then must your brother die.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: And ’twere the cheaper way:
Better it were a brother died at once,
Than that a sister, by redeeming him,
Should die forever.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Were not you then as cruel as the sentence
That you have slander’d so?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Ignomy in ransom and free pardon
Are of two houses: lawful mercy
Is nothing kin to foul redemption.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: You seem’d of late to make the law a tyrant,
And rather prov’d the sliding of your brother
A merriment than a vice.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: O, pardon me, my lord, it oft falls out,
To have what we would have, we speak not what we mean.
I something do excuse the thing I hate,
For his advantage that I dearly love.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: We are all frail.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Else let my brother die,
If not a fedary, but only he,
Owe and succeed thy weakness.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Nay, women are frail too.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Ay, as the glasses where they view themselves,
Which are as easy broke as they make forms.
Women? Help heaven! Men their creation mar
In profiting by them. Nay, call us ten times frail,
For we are soft as our complexions are,
And credulous to false prints.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: I think it well;
And from this testimony of your own sex
(Since I suppose we are made to be no stronger
Than faults may shake our frames), let me be bold.
I do arrest your words. Be that you are,
That is a woman; if you be more, you’re none;
If you be one (as you are well express’d
By all external warrants), show it now,
By putting on the destin’d livery.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: I have no tongue but one; gentle my lord,
Let me entreat you speak the former language.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Plainly conceive, I love you.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: My brother did love Juliet,
And you tell me that he shall die for’t.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: He shall not, Isabel, if you give me love.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: I know your virtue hath a license in’t,
Which seems a little fouler than it is,
To pluck on others.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Believe me, on mine honor,
My words express my purpose.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Ha? Little honor to be much believ’d,
And most pernicious purpose! Seeming, seeming!
I will proclaim thee, Angelo, look for’t!
Sign me a present pardon for my brother,
Or with an outstretch’d throat I’ll tell the world aloud
What man thou art.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Who will believe thee, Isabel?
My unsoil’d name, th’ austereness of my life,
My vouch against you, and my place i’ th’ state,
Will so your accusation overweigh,
That you shall stifle in your own report,
And smell of calumny. I have begun,
And now I give my sensual race the rein.
Fit thy consent to my sharp appetite,
Lay by all nicety and prolixious blushes
That banish what they sue for. Redeem thy brother
By yielding up thy body to my will,
Or else he must not only die the death,
But thy unkindness shall his death draw out
To ling’ring sufferance. Answer me tomorrow,
Or by the affection that now guides me most,
I’ll prove a tyrant to him. As for you,
Say what you can: my false o’erweighs your true.

stagedir.dir: Enter Duke disguised as a friar, Claudio, and Provost.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: My business is a word or two with Claudio.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: And very welcome. Look, signior, here’s your sister.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Provost, a word with you.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: As many as you please.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Bring me to hear them speak, where I may be conceal’d.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Vouchsafe a word, young sister, but one word.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: What is your will?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Might you dispense with your leisure, I would by and by have some speech with you. The satisfaction I would require is likewise your own benefit.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: I have no superfluous leisure; my stay must be stolen out of other affairs; but I will attend you a while.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Son, I have overheard what hath pass’d between you and your sister. Angelo had never the purpose to corrupt her; only he hath made an assay of her virtue to practice his judgment with the disposition of natures. She (having the truth of honor in her) hath made him that gracious denial which he is most glad to receive. I am confessor to Angelo, and I know this to be true; therefore prepare yourself to death. Do not satisfy your resolution with hopes that are fallible, tomorrow you must die; go to your knees, and make ready.

speech.speaker: CLAUD.
speech.line: Let me ask my sister pardon. I am so out of love with life that I will sue to be rid of it.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Hold you there! Farewell.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: What’s your will, father?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: That now you are come, you will be gone. Leave me a while with the maid. My mind promises with my habit, no loss shall touch her by my company.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: In good time.

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: His neck will come to your waist—a cord, sir.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I spy comfort, I cry bail. Here’s a gentleman, and a friend of mine.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: How now, noble Pompey? What, at the wheels of Caesar? Art thou led in triumph? What, is there none of Pygmalion’s images newly made woman to be had now, for putting the hand in the pocket and extracting it clutch’d? What reply? Ha? What say’st thou to this tune, matter, and method? Is’t not drown’d i’ th’ last rain? Ha? What say’st thou, Trot? Is the world as it was, man? Which is the way? Is it sad, and few words? Or how? The trick of it?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Still thus, and thus; still worse!

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: How doth my dear morsel, thy mistress? Procures she still? Ha?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Troth, sir, she hath eaten up all her beef, and she is herself in the tub.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Why, ’tis good; it is the right of it; it must be so. Ever your fresh whore and your powder’d bawd, an unshunn’d consequence; it must be so. Art going to prison, Pompey?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Yes, faith, sir.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Why, ’tis not amiss, Pompey. Farewell. Go say I sent thee thither. For debt, Pompey? Or how?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: For being a bawd, for being a bawd.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Well, then imprison him. If imprisonment be the due of a bawd, why, ’tis his right. Bawd is he doubtless, and of antiquity too; bawd-born. Farewell, good Pompey. Commend me to the prison, Pompey. You will turn good husband now, Pompey, you will keep the house.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I hope, sir, your good worship will be my bail.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: No indeed will I not, Pompey, it is not the wear. I will pray, Pompey, to increase your bondage. If you take it not patiently, why, your mettle is the more. Adieu, trusty Pompey. Bless you, friar.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: And you.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Does Bridget paint still, Pompey? Ha?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: Come your ways, sir, come.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: You will not bail me then, sir?

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Then, Pompey, nor now. What news abroad, friar? What news?

speech.speaker: ELB.
speech.line: Come your ways, sir, come.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Go to kennel, Pompey, go.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: No might nor greatness in mortality
Can censure scape; back-wounding calumny
The whitest virtue strikes. What king so strong
Can tie the gall up in the slanderous tongue?
But who comes here?

stagedir.dir: Enter Escalus, Provost, and Officers with Bawd Mistress Overdone.

speech.line: Provost, my brother Angelo will not be alter’d, Claudio must die tomorrow. Let him be furnish’d with divines, and have all charitable preparation. If my brother wrought by my pity, it should not be so with him.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: So please you, this friar hath been with him, and advis’d him for th’ entertainment of death.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Good even, good father.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Bliss and goodness on you!

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Of whence are you?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Not of this country, though my chance is now
To use it for my time. I am a brother
Of gracious order, late come from the See,
In special business from his Holiness.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: What news abroad i’ th’ world?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: None, but that there is so great a fever on goodness, that the dissolution of it must cure it. Novelty is only in request, and, as it is, as dangerous to be ag’d in any kind of course, as it is virtuous to be constant in any undertaking. There is scarce truth enough alive to make societies secure, but security enough to make fellowships accurs’d. Much upon this riddle runs the wisdom of the world. This news is old enough, yet it is every day’s news. I pray you, sir, of what disposition was the Duke?

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: One that, above all other strifes, contended especially to know himself.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: What pleasure was he given to?

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Rather rejoicing to see another merry, than merry at any thing which profess’d to make him rejoice; a gentleman of all temperance. But leave we him to his events, with a prayer they may prove prosperous, and let me desire to know how you find Claudio prepar’d. I am made to understand that you have lent him visitation.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: He professes to have receiv’d no sinister measure from his judge, but most willingly humbles himself to the determination of justice; yet had he fram’d to himself (by the instruction of his frailty) many deceiving promises of life, which I (by my good leisure) have discredited to him, and now is he resolv’d to die.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: You have paid the heavens your function, and the prisoner the very debt of your calling. I have labor’d for the poor gentleman to the extremest shore of my modesty, but my brother-justice have I found so severe, that he hath forc’d me to tell him he is indeed Justice.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: If his own life answer the straitness of his proceeding, it shall become him well; wherein if he chance to fail, he hath sentenc’d himself.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: I am going to visit the prisoner. Fare you well.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Peace be with you!

scene.scenelocation: The moated grange at St. Luke’s.

speech.speaker: BOY.
speech.line: Take, O, take those lips away,
That so sweetly were forsworn,
And those eyes, the break of day,
Lights that do mislead the morn;
But my kisses bring again, bring again,
Seals of love, but seal’d in vain, seal’d in vain.

stagedir.dir: Enter Duke disguised as a friar.

scene.line: I cry you mercy, sir, and well could wish
You had not found me here so musical.
Let me excuse me, and believe me so,
My mirth it much displeas’d, but pleas’d my woe.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: ’Tis good; though music oft hath such a charm
To make bad good, and good provoke to harm.
I pray you tell me, hath any body inquir’d for me here today? Much upon this time have I promis’d here to meet.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: You have not been inquir’d after. I have sat here all day.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Very well met, and well come.
What is the news from this good deputy?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: He hath a garden circummur’d with brick,
Whose western side is with a vineyard back’d;
And to that vineyard is a planched gate,
That makes his opening with this bigger key.
This other doth command a little door,
Which from the vineyard to the garden leads;
There have I made my promise upon the heavy
Middle of the night to call upon him.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: But shall you on your knowledge find this way?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: I have ta’en a due and wary note upon’t.
With whispering and most guilty diligence,
In action all of precept, he did show me
The way twice o’er.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Are there no other tokens
Between you ’greed concerning her observance?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: No; none but only a repair i’ th’ dark,
And that I have possess’d him my most stay
Can be but brief; for I have made him know
I have a servant comes with me along,
That stays upon me, whose persuasion is
I come about my brother.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: ’Tis well borne up.
I have not yet made known to Mariana
A word of this. What ho, within! Come forth!

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: O place and greatness! Millions of false eyes
Are stuck upon thee. Volumes of report
Run with these false, and most contrarious quest
Upon thy doings; thousand escapes of wit
Make thee the father of their idle dream,
And rack thee in their fancies.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: Come hither, sirrah; can you cut off a man’s head?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: If the man be a bachelor, sir, I can; but if he be a married man, he’s his wive’s head, and I can never cut off a woman’s head.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: Come, sir, leave me your snatches, and yield me a direct answer. Tomorrow morning are to die Claudio and Barnardine. Here is in our prison a common executioner, who in his office lacks a helper. If you will take it on you to assist him, it shall redeem you from your gyves; if not, you shall have your full time of imprisonment, and your deliverance with an unpitied whipping, for you have been a notorious bawd.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Sir, I have been an unlawful bawd time out of mind, but yet I will be content to be a lawful hangman. I would be glad to receive some instruction from my fellow partner.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: What ho, Abhorson! Where’s Abhorson there?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Pray, sir, by your good favor—for surely, sir, a good favor you have, but that you have a hanging look—do you call, sir, your occupation a mystery?

speech.speaker: ABHOR.
speech.line: Ay, sir, a mystery.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Painting, sir, I have heard say, is a mystery; and your whores, sir, being members of my occupation, using painting, do prove my occupation a mystery; but what mystery there should be in hanging, if I should be hang’d, I cannot imagine.

speech.speaker: ABHOR.
speech.line: Sir, it is a mystery.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Proof.

speech.speaker: ABHOR.
speech.line: Every true man’s apparel fits your thief. If it be too little for your thief, your true man thinks it big enough; if it be too big for your thief, your thief thinks it little enough; so every true man’s apparel fits your thief.
Th’ one has my pity; not a jot the other,
Being a murderer, though he were my brother.
By and by.—
I hope it is some pardon or reprieve
For the most gentle Claudio.

stagedir.dir: Enter Duke disguised as a friar.

speech.line: This is a gentle Provost: seldom when
The steeled jailer is the friend of men.
How now? What noise? That spirit’s possess’d with haste
That wounds th’ unsisting postern with these strokes.
This is his Lordship’s man.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: And here comes Claudio’s pardon.

speech.speaker: MESS.
speech.line: My lord hath sent you this note, and by me this further charge: that you swerve not from the smallest article of it, neither in time, matter, or other circumstance. Good morrow; for as I take it, it is almost day.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: I shall obey him.

scene.line: This is his pardon, purchas’d by such sin
For which the pardoner himself is in.
Hence hath offense his quick celerity,
When it is borne in high authority.
When vice makes mercy, mercy’s so extended,
That for the fault’s love is th’ offender friended.
Now, sir, what news?

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: I told you: Lord Angelo (belike) thinking me remiss in mine office, awakens me with this unwonted putting-on, methinks strangely, for he hath not us’d it before.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Pray you let’s hear.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: I am as well acquainted here as I was in our house of profession. One would think it were Mistress Overdone’s own house, for here be many of her old customers. First, here’s young Master Rash, he’s in for a commodity of brown paper and old ginger, ninescore and seventeen pounds, of which he made five marks ready money. Marry, then ginger was not much in request, for the old women were all dead. Then is there here one Master Caper, at the suit of Master Three-pile the mercer, for some four suits of peach-color’d satin, which now peaches him a beggar. Then have we here young Dizzy, and young Master Deep-vow, and Master Copper-spur, and Master Starve-lackey the rapier and dagger man, and young Drop-heir that kill’d lusty Pudding, and Master Forthlight the tilter, and brave Master Shoe-tie the great traveller, and wild Half-can that stabb’d Pots, and I think forty more, all great doers in our trade, and are now “for the Lord’s sake.”

speech.speaker: ABHOR.
speech.line: Is the axe upon the block, sirrah?

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: Very ready, sir.

speech.speaker: BAR.
speech.line: How now, Abhorson? What’s the news with you?

speech.speaker: ABHOR.
speech.line: Truly, sir, I would desire you to clap into your prayers; for look you, the warrant’s come.

speech.speaker: BAR.
speech.line: You rogue, I have been drinking all night, I am not fitted for’t.

speech.speaker: POM.
speech.line: O, the better, sir; for he that drinks all night, and is hang’d betimes in the morning, may sleep the sounder all the next day.

stagedir.dir: Enter Duke disguised as a friar.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: Now, sir, how do you find the prisoner?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: A creature unprepar’d, unmeet for death;
And to transport him in the mind he is
Were damnable.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: Here in the prison, father,
There died this morning of a cruel fever
One Ragozine, a most notorious pirate,
A man of Claudio’s years; his beard and head
Just of his color. What if we do omit
This reprobate till he were well inclin’d,
And satisfy the deputy with the visage
Of Ragozine, more like to Claudio?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: O, ’tis an accident that heaven provides!
Dispatch it presently, the hour draws on
Prefix’d by Angelo. See this be done,
And sent according to command, whiles I
Persuade this rude wretch willingly to die.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: This shall be done, good father, presently.
But Barnardine must die this afternoon;
And how shall we continue Claudio,
To save me from the danger that might come
If he were known alive?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Let this be done:
Put them in secret holds, both Barnardine and Claudio.
Ere twice the sun hath made his journal greeting
To yond generation, you shall find
Your safety manifested.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: I am your free dependant.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Quick, dispatch, and send the head to Angelo.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: Here is the head, I’ll carry it myself.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Convenient is it. Make a swift return,
For I would commune with you of such things
That want no ear but yours.

speech.speaker: PROV.
speech.line: I’ll make all speed.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Ho, by your leave!

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Good morning to you, fair and gracious daughter.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: The better, given me by so holy a man.
Hath yet the deputy sent my brother’s pardon?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: He hath releas’d him, Isabel, from the world,
His head is off, and sent to Angelo.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Nay, but it is not so.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: It is no other.
Show your wisdom, daughter, in your close patience.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: O, I will to him, and pluck out his eyes!

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: You shall not be admitted to his sight.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Unhappy Claudio! Wretched Isabel!
Injurious world! Most damned Angelo!

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: This nor hurts him, nor profits you a jot.
Forbear it therefore, give your cause to heaven.
Mark what I say, which you shall find
By every syllable a faithful verity.
The Duke comes home tomorrow—nay, dry your eyes—
One of our covent, and his confessor,
Gives me this instance: already he hath carried
Notice to Escalus and Angelo,
Who do prepare to meet him at the gates,
There to give up their pow’r. If you can pace your wisdom
In that good path that I would wish it go,
And you shall have your bosom on this wretch,
Grace of the Duke, revenges to your heart,
And general honor.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: I am directed by you.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: This letter then to Friar Peter give;
’Tis that he sent me of the Duke’s return.
Say, by this token, I desire his company
At Mariana’s house tonight. Her cause and yours
I’ll perfect him withal, and he shall bring you
Before the Duke; and to the head of Angelo
Accuse him home and home. For my poor self,
I am combined by a sacred vow,
And shall be absent. Wend you with this letter.
Command these fretting waters from your eyes
With a light heart; trust not my holy order
If I pervert your course. Who’s here?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Sir, the Duke is marvellous little beholding to your reports, but the best is, he lives not in them.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Friar, thou knowest not the Duke so well as I do; he’s a better woodman than thou tak’st him for.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Well; you’ll answer this one day. Fare ye well.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Nay, tarry, I’ll go along with thee. I can tell thee pretty tales of the Duke.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: You have told me too many of him already, sir, if they be true; if not true, none were enough.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: I was once before him for getting a wench with child.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Did you such a thing?

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Yes, marry, did I; but I was fain to forswear it. They would else have married me to the rotten medlar.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Sir, your company is fairer than honest. Rest you well.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: By my troth, I’ll go with thee to the lane’s end. If bawdy talk offend you, we’ll have very little of it. Nay, friar, I am a kind of bur, I shall stick.

scene.line: This deed unshapes me quite, makes me unpregnant
And dull to all proceedings. A deflow’red maid!
And by an eminent body that enforc’d
The law against it! But that her tender shame
Will not proclaim against her maiden loss,
How might she tongue me! Yet reason dares her no,
For my authority bears of a credent bulk,
That no particular scandal once can touch
But it confounds the breather. He should have liv’d,
Save that his riotous youth with dangerous sense
Might in the times to come have ta’en revenge,
By so receiving a dishonor’d life
With ransom of such shame. Would yet he had liv’d!
Alack, when once our grace we have forgot,
Nothing goes right—we would, and we would not.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: These letters at fit time deliver me.
The Provost knows our purpose and our plot.
The matter being afoot, keep your instruction,
And hold you ever to our special drift,
Though sometimes you do blench from this to that,
As cause doth minister. Go call at Flavio’s house,
And tell him where I stay. Give the like notice
To Valentius, Rowland, and to Crassus,
And bid them bring the trumpets to the gate.
But send me Flavius first.

speech.speaker: FRI. PET.
speech.line: It shall be speeded well.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: I thank thee, Varrius, thou hast made good haste.
Come, we will walk. There’s other of our friends
Will greet us here anon. My gentle Varrius!

scene.scenelocation: A street near the city gate.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: I would Friar Peter—

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: O, peace, the friar is come.

speech.speaker: FRI. PET.
speech.line: Come, I have found you out a stand most fit,
Where you may have such vantage on the Duke,
He shall not pass you. Twice have the trumpets sounded;
The generous and gravest citizens
Have hent the gates, and very near upon
The Duke is ent’ring; therefore hence away!

stagedir.dir: Flourish. Enter Duke, Varrius, Lords, Angelo, Escalus, Lucio, Provost, Officers, Citizens at several doors.

speech.speaker: FRI. PET.
speech.line: Now is your time: speak loud, and kneel before him.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Justice, O royal Duke! Vail your regard
Upon a wrong’d—I would fain have said a maid!
O worthy Prince, dishonor not your eye
By throwing it on any other object,
Till you have heard me in my true complaint,
And given me justice, justice, justice, justice!

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Relate your wrongs. In what? By whom? Be brief.
Here is Lord Angelo shall give you justice;
Reveal yourself to him.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: O worthy Duke,
You bid me seek redemption of the devil.
Hear me yourself; for that which I must speak
Must either punish me, not being believ’d,
Or wring redress from you. Hear me, O hear me, here.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: My lord, her wits, I fear me, are not firm.
She hath been a suitor to me for her brother,
Cut off by course of justice—

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: By course of justice!

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: And she will speak most bitterly and strange.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: Most strange! But yet most truly will I speak:
That Angelo’s forsworn, is it not strange?
That Angelo’s a murderer, is’t not strange?
That Angelo is an adulterous thief,
An hypocrite, a virgin-violator,
Is it not strange? And strange?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Nay, it is ten times strange.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: It is not truer he is Angelo
Than this is all as true as it is strange;
Nay, it is ten times true, for truth is truth
To th’ end of reck’ning.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Away with her! Poor soul,
She speaks this in th’ infirmity of sense.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: O Prince, I conjure thee, as thou believ’st
There is another comfort than this world,
That thou neglect me not, with that opinion
That I am touch’d with madness. Make not impossible
That which but seems unlike; ’tis not impossible
But one the wicked’st caitiff on the ground,
May seem as shy, as grave, as just, as absolute
As Angelo. Even so may Angelo,
In all his dressings, caracts, titles, forms,
Be an arch-villain. Believe it, royal Prince,
If he be less, he’s nothing, but he’s more,
Had I more name for badness.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: By mine honesty,
If she be mad, as I believe no other,
Her madness hath the oddest frame of sense,
Such a dependancy of thing on thing,
As e’er I heard in madness.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: O gracious Duke,
Harp not on that; nor do not banish reason
For inequality, but let your reason serve
To make the truth appear, where it seems hid,
And hide the false seems true.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Many that are not mad
Have sure more lack of reason. What would you say?

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: I am the sister of one Claudio,
Condemn’d upon the act of fornication
To lose his head, condemn’d by Angelo.
I (in probation of a sisterhood)
Was sent to by my brother; one Lucio
As then the messenger—

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: That’s I, and’t like your Grace.
I came to her from Claudio, and desir’d her
To try her gracious fortune with Lord Angelo,
For her poor brother’s pardon.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: That’s he indeed.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Is this the witness, friar?
First, let her show her face, and after speak.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: Pardon, my lord, I will not show my face
Until my husband bid me.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: What, are you married?

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: No, my lord.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Are you a maid?

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: No, my lord.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: A widow then?

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: Neither, my lord.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Why, you are nothing then: neither maid, widow, nor wife?

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: My lord, she may be a punk; for many of them are neither maid, widow, nor wife.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Silence that fellow. I would he had some cause
To prattle for himself.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Well, my lord.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: My lord, I do confess I ne’er was married,
And I confess besides I am no maid.
I have known my husband, yet my husband
Knows not that ever he knew me.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: He was drunk then, my lord, it can be no better.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: For the benefit of silence, would thou wert so too!

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Well, my lord.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: This is no witness for Lord Angelo.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: Now I come to’t, my lord.
She that accuses him of fornication,
In self-same manner doth accuse my husband,
And charges him, my lord, with such a time
When I’ll depose I had him in mine arms
With all th’ effect of love.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Charges she more than me?

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: Not that I know.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: No? You say your husband.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: Why, just, my lord, and that is Angelo,
Who thinks he knows that he ne’er knew my body,
But knows he thinks that he knows Isabel’s.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: This is a strange abuse. Let’s see thy face.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: My husband bids me, now I will unmask.
This is that face, thou cruel Angelo,
Which once thou swor’st was worth the looking on;
This is the hand which, with a vow’d contract,
Was fast belock’d in thine; this is the body
That took away the match from Isabel,
And did supply thee at thy garden-house
In her imagin’d person.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Know you this woman?

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Carnally, she says.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Sirrah, no more!

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Enough, my lord.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: My lord, I must confess I know this woman,
And five years since there was some speech of marriage
Betwixt myself and her; which was broke off,
Partly for that her promised proportions
Came short of composition, but in chief
For that her reputation was disvalued
In levity. Since which time of five years
I never spake with her, saw her, nor heard from her,
Upon my faith and honor.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: Noble Prince,
As there comes light from heaven, and words from breath,
As there is sense in truth, and truth in virtue,
I am affianc’d this man’s wife as strongly
As words could make up vows; and, my good lord,
But Tuesday night last gone, in ’s garden-house,
He knew me as a wife. As this is true,
Let me in safety raise me from my knees,
Or else forever be confixed here,
A marble monument!

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: I did but smile till now.
Now, good my lord, give me the scope of justice,
My patience here is touch’d. I do perceive
These poor informal women are no more
But instruments of some more mightier member
That sets them on. Let me have way, my lord,
To find this practice out.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Ay, with my heart,
And punish them to your height of pleasure.
Thou foolish friar, and thou pernicious woman,
Compact with her that’s gone, think’st thou thy oaths,
Though they would swear down each particular saint,
Were testimonies against his worth and credit
That’s seal’d in approbation? You, Lord Escalus,
Sit with my cousin; lend him your kind pains
To find out this abuse, whence ’tis deriv’d.
There is another friar that set them on,
Let him be sent for.

speech.speaker: FRI. PET.
speech.line: Would he were here, my lord, for he indeed
Hath set the women on to this complaint.
Your Provost knows the place where he abides,
And he may fetch him.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Go, do it instantly.
Signior Lucio, did not you say you knew that Friar Lodowick to be a dishonest person?

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Cucullus non facit monachum: honest in nothing but in his clothes, and one that hath spoke most villainous speeches of the Duke.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: We shall entreat you to abide here till he come, and enforce them against him. We shall find this friar a notable fellow.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: As any in Vienna, on my word.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Call that same Isabel here once again, I would speak with her.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: I will go darkly to work with her.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: That’s the way; for women are light at midnight.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Come on, mistress. Here’s a gentlewoman denies all that you have said.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: My lord, here comes the rascal I spoke of, here with the Provost.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: In very good time. Speak not you to him till we call upon you.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Mum.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Come, sir, did you set these women on to slander Lord Angelo? They have confess’d you did.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: ’Tis false.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: How! Know you where you are?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Respect to your great place! And let the devil
Be sometime honor’d for his burning throne!
Where is the Duke? ’Tis he should hear me speak.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: The Duke’s in us; and we will hear you speak:
Look you speak justly.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Boldly, at least. But O, poor souls,
Come you to seek the lamb here of the fox,
Good night to your redress! Is the Duke gone?
Then is your cause gone too. The Duke’s unjust
Thus to retort your manifest appeal,
And put your trial in the villain’s mouth
Which here you come to accuse.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: This is the rascal; this is he I spoke of.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Why, thou unreverend and unhallowed friar,
Is’t not enough thou hast suborn’d these women
To accuse this worthy man, but in foul mouth,
And in the witness of his proper ear,
To call him villain, and then to glance from him
To th’ Duke himself, to tax him with injustice?
Take him hence; to th’ rack with him! We’ll touze you
Joint by joint, but we will know his purpose.
What? “unjust”?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Be not so hot. The Duke
Dare no more stretch this finger of mine than he
Dare rack his own. His subject am I not,
Nor here provincial. My business in this state
Made me a looker-on here in Vienna,
Where I have seen corruption boil and bubble,
Till it o’errun the stew; laws for all faults,
But faults so countenanc’d, that the strong statutes
Stand like the forfeits in a barber’s shop,
As much in mock as mark.

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Slander to th’ state!
Away with him to prison.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: What can you vouch
Against him, Signior Lucio? Is this the man
That you did tell us of?

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: ’Tis he, my lord.
Come hither, goodman bald-pate, do you know me?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: I remember you, sir, by the sound of your voice; I met you at the prison, in the absence of the Duke.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: O, did you so? And do you remember what you said of the Duke?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Most notedly, sir.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Do you so, sir? And was the Duke a flesh-monger, a fool, and a coward, as you then reported him to be?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: You must, sir, change persons with me, ere you make that my report. You indeed spoke so of him, and much more, much worse.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: O thou damnable fellow! Did not I pluck thee by the nose for thy speeches?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: I protest I love the Duke as I love myself.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: Hark how the villain would close now, after his treasonable abuses!

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: Such a fellow is not to be talk’d withal. Away with him to prison! Where is the Provost? Away with him to prison! Lay bolts enough upon him. Let him speak no more. Away with those giglets too, and with the other confederate companion!

stagedir.dir: The Provost lays hands on the Duke.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Stay, sir, stay a while.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: What, resists he? Help him, Lucio.

speech.speaker: LUCIO.
speech.line: Come, sir, come, sir, come, sir; foh, sir, why, you bald-pated, lying rascal, you must be hooded, must you? Show your knave’s visage, with a pox to you! Show your sheep-biting face, and be hang’d an hour! Will’t not off?

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Thou art the first knave that e’er mad’st a duke.
First, Provost, let me bail these gentle three.
What you have spoke I pardon. Sit you down,
We’ll borrow place of him.—Sir, by your leave.
Hast thou or word, or wit, or impudence,
That yet can do thee office? If thou hast,
Rely upon it till my tale be heard,
And hold no longer out.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: O my dread lord,
I should be guiltier than my guiltiness,
To think I can be undiscernible,
When I perceive your Grace, like pow’r divine,
Hath look’d upon my passes. Then, good Prince,
No longer session hold upon my shame,
But let my trial be mine own confession.
Immediate sentence then, and sequent death,
Is all the grace I beg.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Come hither, Mariana.
Say: wast thou e’er contracted to this woman?

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: I was, my lord.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Go take her hence, and marry her instantly.
Do you the office, friar, which consummate,
Return him here again. Go with him, Provost.

stagedir.dir: Exeunt Angelo, Mariana, Friar Peter, Provost.

speech.speaker: ISAB.
speech.line: I do, my lord.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: For this new-married man approaching here,
Whose salt imagination yet hath wrong’d
Your well-defended honor, you must pardon
For Mariana’s sake; but as he adjudg’d your brother—
Being criminal, in double violation
Of sacred chastity and of promise-breach,
Thereon dependant, for your brother’s life—
The very mercy of the law cries out
Most audible, even from his proper tongue,
“An Angelo for Claudio, death for death!”
Haste still pays haste, and leisure answers leisure;
Like doth quit like, and Measure still for Measure.
Then, Angelo, thy fault’s thus manifested;
Which though thou wouldst deny, denies thee vantage.
We do condemn thee to the very block
Where Claudio stoop’d to death, and with like haste.
Away with him!

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: O my most gracious lord,
I hope you will not mock me with a husband!

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: It is your husband mock’d you with a husband.
Consenting to the safeguard of your honor,
I thought your marriage fit; else imputation,
For that he knew you, might reproach your life,
And choke your good to come. For his possessions,
Although by confiscation they are ours,
We do enstate and widow you with all,
To buy you a better husband.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: O my dear lord,
I crave no other, nor no better man.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Never crave him, we are definitive.

speech.speaker: MARI.
speech.line: Gentle my liege—

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: You do but lose your labor.
Away with him to death!

speech.speaker: ESCAL.
speech.line: I am sorry, one so learned and so wise
As you, Lord Angelo, have still appear’d,
Should slip so grossly, both in the heat of blood
And lack of temper’d judgment afterward.

speech.speaker: ANG.
speech.line: I am sorry that such sorrow I procure,
And so deep sticks it in my penitent heart
That I crave death more willingly than mercy:
’Tis my deserving, and I do entreat it.

stagedir.dir: Enter Barnardine and Provost, Claudio muffled, Julietta.

speech.line: If he be like your brother, for his sake
Is he pardon’d, and for your lovely sake,
Give me your hand, and say you will be mine,
He is my brother too. But fitter time for that.
By this Lord Angelo perceives he’s safe;
Methinks I see a quick’ning in his eye.
Well, Angelo, your evil quits you well.
Look that you love your wife; her worth worth yours.
I find an apt remission in myself;
And yet here’s one in place I cannot pardon.
She, Claudio, that you wrong’d, look you restore.
Joy to you, Mariana! Love her, Angelo!
I have confess’d her, and I know her virtue.
Thanks, good friend Escalus, for thy much goodness,
There’s more behind that is more gratulate.
Thanks, Provost, for thy care and secrecy,
We shall employ thee in a worthier place.
Forgive him, Angelo, that brought you home
The head of Ragozine for Claudio’s,
Th’ offense pardons itself. Dear Isabel,
I have a motion much imports your good,
Whereto if you’ll a willing ear incline,
What’s mine is yours, and what is yours is mine.
So bring us to our palace, where we’ll show
What’s yet behind, that’s meet you all should know.
